metadata.title: CVE-2024-5642 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - low
metadata.description:
CPython 3.9 and earlier doesn't disallow configuring an empty list ("[]")for SSLContext.set_npn_protocols() which is an invalid value for theunderlying OpenSSL API. This results in a buffer over-read when NPN is used(see CVE-2024-5535 for OpenSSL). This vulnerability is of low severity dueto NPN being not widely used and specifying an empty list likely beinguncommon in-practice (typically a protocol name would be configured).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-5642` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

idle-python3.10 - 3.10.4-3
libpython3.10 - 3.10.4-3
libpython3.10-minimal - 3.10.4-3
libpython3.10-stdlib - 3.10.4-3
libpython3.10-testsuite - 3.10.4-3
python3.10 - 3.10.4-3
python3.10-examples - 3.10.4-3
python3.10-full - 3.10.4-3
python3.10-minimal - 3.10.4-3
python3.10-nopie - 3.10.4-3
python3.10-venv - 3.10.4-3
No subscription required

idle-python3.11 - 3.11.0~rc1-1~22.04
libpython3.11 - 3.11.0~rc1-1~22.04
libpython3.11-minimal - 3.11.0~rc1-1~22.04
libpython3.11-stdlib - 3.11.0~rc1-1~22.04
libpython3.11-testsuite - 3.11.0~rc1-1~22.04
python3.11 - 3.11.0~rc1-1~22.04
python3.11-examples - 3.11.0~rc1-1~22.04
python3.11-full - 3.11.0~rc1-1~22.04
python3.11-minimal - 3.11.0~rc1-1~22.04
python3.11-nopie - 3.11.0~rc1-1~22.04
python3.11-venv - 3.11.0~rc1-1~22.04
No subscription required

criterions.comment: python2.7 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
python3.10 package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.10.4-3').
python3.11 package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.11.0~rc1-1~22.04').
